page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content:
This area, to the south east of Chester is mostly rural: some market gardening near the city but largely dairy farming.
There are two large schools, an FE college, two army establishments and the River Dee in this area. Life in this area is quite relaxed although the one square kilometre in the city is often thronged with tourists. A by-road through the area keeps much of the traffic away from the residential areas but the congestion on the roads is still sufficiently horrendous to keep most Cestrians away from the centre on Saturdays.
